conclusion: To solve the problem, I will analyze the image to understand the geometry of the light beam's path.
I will then apply the principles of refraction to determine the correct position of point O1 relative to point O.

The image shows a boundary line between air and water. A light beam travels from point A in the air, passing through point O on the boundary, and then continues into the water, reaching point B. The line AB intersects the boundary at point O.
The light beam travels from point A in the air, passing through point O on the boundary, and then into the water, reaching point B.
The boundary line represents the interface between air and water.
According to the principle of refraction, the angle of incidence equals the angle of refraction.
Since the light beam is traveling from air into water, the angle of incidence at point O is greater than the angle of incidence at point O1.
The angle of incidence at point O1 is less than the angle of incidence at point O because the light beam is moving from a denser medium (water) to a less dense medium (air).
Therefore, point O1 must be to the right of point O.
